intro: Rubus acclivitatum, commonly known as the alpine bramble, is a shrub native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or black in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its ecological significance, it plays a vital role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine wildlife.
